div.p: Philonides to his father, greetings. I hope you are in good health; I am well too. Also in our previous letters we have written you that we have neither the [...] nor the linen cloths. As soon as we get them, [we will [send them. You should know that Sat]yros is in Memphis, ill, and that [he is staying in] the Asklepieion. Greetings. [Year ...], Pharmouthi [...]. Translation with slight modifications: B. Van Beek in P.Petr.Kleon, p. 38, Â© Peeters
